description:
The fictional Japanese city named Sugomori City is built on reclaimed land. But as the years go by, the city's population is decreasing. One day, Sonosaki tells her classmate Katsuhira: "You have been selected to be a Kiznaiver." The Kizuna System, which allows Katsuhira to share his wounds, connects him to the classmates whose lives and personalities completely differ from his. The Kizuna System is an incomplete system for the implementation of world peace that connects people through wounds. All those who are connected to this system are called Kiznaivers. When one Kiznaiver is wounded, the system divides and transmits the wound among the other Kiznaivers.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

title.native: 小説　キズナイーバー　－あの日のキズ、これからのキズナ－

node.description: Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Official Website](http://mmm-gee.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zi38)

Shirow Miwa is a Japanese manga artist and illustrator. He is best known as the writer and artist for the Dogs manga series, but has also contributed illustrations to various tribute books, and magazines, including Square Enix's Monthly Shounen Gangan. Miwa sometimes publishes under the circle name of m.m.m. + Gee. He is also an official member of Doujin Band Supercell as Illustrator and Designer. Miwa also drew the character designs for the games 7th Dragon 2020, 7th Dragon 2020-II and 7th Dragon III code:VFD which are sequel games (in that order) within the 7th Dragon series.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbs_staff/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/boomboomsatellites)__

__Formed:__ 1990
__Disbanded:__ 2017
__Genres:__ J-POP, Electropop, Electronica, Rock (Alternative Rock, Punk Rock, Post Rock, Industrial Rock, Digital Rock), Big Beat

__Introduction:__
Boom Boom Satellites were a Japanese rock band under record label gr8! records (2004–2017), having previously been under record labels R&S Records (1997) and Sony Music Associated Records (1998–2003). The duo consisted of former vocalist and guitarist Michiyuki Kawashima and bassist and programmer Masayuki Nakano, who were active between 1990–2017.

__Biography:__
The band's vocalist and guitarist Michiyuki went through a long battle against a brain tumor, which sadly took his life on October 9, 2016. The band's last live event was held at Shinkiba Studio Coast on June 18, 2017, but even after their last live event Masayuki declared he would continue to bear the band's name.

__Final Members:__
- Michiyuki Kawashima (川島道行, かわしまみちゆき) – vocalist, guitarist (1990–2016)
- Masayuki Nakano (中野雅之, なかのまさゆき) – bassist, programmer (1990–2017)

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boom_Boom_Satellites), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tuka_trg)

After graduating from the Department of Art at Osaka University of Arts he joined Studio Ghibli as photographer and later transferred to Gainax, where he made his debut as director on some episodes of Evangelion.
    
He left Gainax in 2011 to found [Studio Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/Trigger) together with [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi) and [Kazuya Masumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/150019/Kazuya-Masumoto). He is currently the CEO of the company.

[Official Site](https://www.phantasia.jp/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/3pasiofficial/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5WmX340gDNLIAyUcg4MzWN) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/3_phantasia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4lk0Ob-F3ptOQUUq8s0pzQ)

Sangatsu no Phantasia is a Japanese music unit which is signed to Sacra Music. It consists of vocalist [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia), whose music videos and promotional images are illustrated by various artists. The unit began activities in 2015 when it uploaded its first song "Day Break" on YouTube, before making its major debut in 2016. In addition to producing music, Mia also writes novels, with some of the unit's songs being based on her novels.

**Members:** 

- Vocals: [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia)
- Composer: [Scop](https://twitter.com/scopscop)
- Illustrator: [Natsu Asami](https://twitter.com/72desuyo)
- Composer: [n-buna](https://twitter.com/nabuna2)
- Composer: [Yuuyu](https://twitter.com/yuuyu_ssry)
- Composer: [40mp](https://twitter.com/40mP)
- Composer: [buzz-G](https://twitter.com/buzz_g)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/96109118) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/porigoshi/)

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Currently a freelancer, but has close ties to [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/). He also took part in the production of Steven Universe, an American cartoon. He worked as a storyboarder on the 107th episode of the series and the feature film which was released in 2019.
